author: powercode
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
[pscustomobject] @{Id=1;Name="This`nIs some random`nmultiline content"} | format-table -Wrap
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Id Name
-- ----
 1 This
   Is some random
   multiline content
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Id Name
-- ----
 1 This
 Is some random
 multiline content
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.1.0-preview.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.16299
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

Works OK in pwsh 6.0.2.

@SteveL-MSFT - I think this is a regression introduced by the trimming.
title: Format-Table -Wrap is broken
